alert.note: Alert for Taylor; Washington (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 10:08PM EDT until July 29 at 8:56PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky and SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, in NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Larue, Nelson and Washington. In SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Marion and Taylor. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1008 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lebanon, New Haven, Loretto, Bradfordsville, Raywick, Saint Joseph, Saint Francis, Dant, Saint Mary and Attilla. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
